thread.title: Carroll scores 16, Raptors beat Wizards 92-82 in preseason
thread.title_full: Carroll scores 16, Raptors beat Wizards 92-82 in preseason

title: Carroll scores 16, Raptors beat Wizards 92-82 in preseason
text:
Carroll scores 16, Raptors close preseason with 92-82 victory over Washington Wizards THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:59   10:59   
People: Photo Gallery: 
Click to view (6 Photos) 
MONTREAL â€” DeMarre Carroll scored 16 points and Kyle Lowry had 13 to lead the Toronto Raptors to a 92-82 win over the Washington Wizards on Friday night in the final preseason game for both. 
DeMar DeRozan and Jonas Valanciunas added 12 points each, and Cory Joseph had 10 points off the bench. 
Raptors: Trailed for most of the first half but took their first lead late in the second quarter and led 46-45 at halftime. ... Terrence Ross made the only one of 10 three-point attempts in the first half for Toronto (5-2). ... Former No. 1 draft pick Anthony Bennett made his first appearance in the fourth quarter, played 7:24 and had one field goal. 
Wizards: Marcin Gortat's 16 points led Washington (4-3). ... Coach Randy Wittman went with a starting lineup of Gortat at center, John Wall and Bradley Beal in the backcourt, forwards Kris Humphries and Otto Porter Jr. 
Up next: Toronto and Washington open the regular season Wednesday. The Raptors host the Indiana Pacers and the Wizards host the Orlando Magic.
